See also: fahr rad

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

fahren (“drive/ride”) +‎ Rad (“wheel”). Compare Dutch rijwiel

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈfaːɐ̯ˌʁa(ː)t/ (standard)
  • IPA(key): /ˈfaʁat/ (chiefly western Germany)
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)
  • Hyphenation: Fahr‧rad

Noun[edit]

Fahrrad n (genitive Fahrrades or Fahrrads, plural Fahrräder)

  1. bicycle

Declension[edit]

1Now uncommon, see notes

Synonyms[edit]

  • Drahtesel (humorous)
  • Fietse (colloquial; north-western Germany)
  • Velo (Swiss)

Hypernyms[edit]

  • Zweirad

Hyponyms[edit]

  • Damenrad
  • Hollandrad
  • Rennrad

Derived terms[edit]

  • Fahrradweg
